intro: Vilfa stolonifera var. marina, commonly known as sea blite, is a halophytic plant adapted to coastal environments. It thrives in saline soils and is often found in tidal zones and sandy beaches. The plant has a prostrate growth habit with fleshy, succulent leaves that store water. Its small, greenish-white flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It plays an important role in stabilizing coastal dunes and preventing erosion.
